DOC.brief_title: Lymphocyte Infusion Treating Patients With Relapsed Cancer After Bone Marrow Peripheral Stem Cell Transplantation
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Offer donor lymphocyte infusion adoptive immunotherapy patient relapse malignancy allogeneic bone marrow peripheral blood stem cell transplantation eligible FHCRC protocol . OUTLINE : Patients rapidly progressive disease receive reinduction chemotherapy radiotherapy prior study therapy . Donor lymphocyte infusion ( DLI ) begin recovery chemotherapy sooner , clinically indicate . Patients receive 1 DLI original donor . Patients follow monthly 3 month , every 3-6 month 9 month . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : An unlimited number patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosis relapse malignancy allogeneic transplantation Rapidly progressive malignancy ( acute leukemia ) receive induction chemotherapy radiotherapy prior study Persistent donor cell Must able tolerate taper steroid dosage great 0.25 mg/kg/day immunosuppressive therapy 2 week without significant flare graft v host disease ( GVHD ) No grade IIIV acute GVHD extensive chronic GVHD Same donor prior transplant PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 1 70 Performance status : Karnofsky 30100 % Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Not specify Hepatic : Not specify Renal : Not specify Other : HIV negative PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : See Disease Characteristics Chemotherapy : See Disease Characteristics Endocrine therapy : See Disease Characteristics At least 1 week since immunosuppressive therapy advance malignancy At least 2 week since immunosuppressive therapy nonadvanced malignancy Radiotherapy : See Disease Characteristics Surgery : Not specify
